page.title: 19Tourism Chaldon Hills
page.content: There are no formal tourist facilities although the Army Camp (see Armed Forces) has viewing facilities beside its firing range. Most tourists pass through en route to and from the coast. Tourists who do visit the block come by car to picnic or walk along public rights of way. The routes offer walks along the downland ridges, with extensive views over the sea to the South and Dorset heathlands to the North, and more intimate surroundings along the valley bottoms. Apart from providing an opportunity to "get-away-from-it-all" the public rights of way enable tourists to observe the extensive range of flora and fauna (see Ecology).
